metadata.synopsis: Aspiring Secret Service agent Sam Simms (Sinbad) is none too happy when he discovers that he has been assigned to guard teenager Luke (Brock Pierce), the rambunctious son of the United States president (James Naughton). While Simms and Luke initially clash, they slowly form a friendship, particularly bonding over the young student's issues with a bully. The pair's improved relationship, however, doesn't stop the trouble-prone kid from getting into plenty of antics.

reviews: Technically, this thing is just all over the place, and it's hard for me to overlook it...
Fine, a little long despite only being 104 minutes...the chemistry did kick in around the second half, but it's just an implausible, crazy movie...
Goofy '90s comedy with pratfalls and some gunplay.
Unfunny Disney comedy. Sinbad needs a better vehicle.
The film sags around mid-point and never completely recovers.
